qas.question: When did the reference Catelaner first appear?
What is a Catalan person called in the 15th century?
What language is the source of the term Catellain?
What is the language source of the term Catelaner?
Since what year has this term been used?

context: In <a3_0>English<a3_0/>, the term referring to a person first appears in the <a0_0>mid 14th century<a0_0/> as Catelaner, followed in the 15th century as <a1_0>Catellain<a1_0/> (from <a2_0>French<a2_0/>). It is attested a language name since at least <a4_0>1652<a4_0/>. Catalan can be pronounced as /ˈkætəlæn/, /kætəˈlæn/ or /ˈkætələn/.
